title: This Washington-Based Company Could Be a Smart Buy for Growth Investors
text: Amazon is an important business, and that's not likely to change anytime soon. The company's cloud-computing platform generates most of its profits, and demand is currently outpacing supply.

title: Stock Market This Week: AMZN & GOOGL Rally, META Falls on Earnings
text: It was another volatile week thanks in part to a hawkish interest rate cut from the FOMC, though three of the four major indices closed higher. Another factor behind volatility: five of the Mag 7 reporting earnings.

title: Amazon stock hits record, lights up ETFs
text: Amazon's cloud business knocked it out of the park and CEO Andy Jassy hinted that the unit is gaining momentum heading into the next few months giving him 'significant confidence' he said.

title: Final Trade: ROKU, KWEB, AMZN, META
text: The final trades of the day with CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders.

title: Amazon's Future Is Autonomous
text: Automation compresses Amazon.com, Inc.'s cost-to-serve, expanding gross margins while enabling selective price deflation that amplifies consumer demand and loyalty. AMZN volume growth compounds operating leverage, creating a self-reinforcing EPS–revenue flywheel that sustains double-digit earnings growth well into maturity. Vertical integration across logistics and AWS anchors durable cash-flow generation, positioning AMZN as the structural beneficiary of autonomous global productivity.

title: Amazon Earnings: 3 Catalysts That Could Drive Shares to $300
text: Amazon.com Inc. NASDAQ: AMZN just delivered the kind of quarter we, and most of Wall Street, had been waiting for. After months of consolidation below the $240 ceiling and making investors sweat about potential downtrends, Thursday night's earnings report just blew the doors off its hinges.

title: Big Tech earnings recap: Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, and Alphabet
text: Big Tech companies including Meta, Microsoft, Alphabet, Apple, and Amazon all reported their quarterly earnings this past week. We speak to Wall Street insiders to analyze the results, key themes for investors including Ai capex spending, the outlook for growth, and opportunities for investors.

text: Amazon's sales are growing faster than Walmart's, and Amazon is finally in striking distance of the top spot. AI is its primary growth engine, but e-commerce is also expanding rapidly.

title: Amazon: The Boat Is Re-Accelerating (Rating Upgrade)
text: Amazon is upgraded to a 'Buy' as AWS shows strong reacceleration, alleviating previous concerns about slowing growth. AWS posted 20.2% YoY growth, driven by robust AI and infrastructure demand, reinforcing Amazon's dominant cloud position and investor confidence. Despite Azure and Google Cloud growing faster, AWS remains the largest cloud platform, with recent outages highlighting enterprise reliance on its services.

The company beat Wall Street expectations for the third quarter, with Amazon Web Services (AWS) accounting for a significant portion of the company's growth and revenue.

title: Amazon: The Most Misunderstood AI Stock On Wall Street
text: Amazon.com, Inc. is rated a Strong Buy due to its aggressive AI investments, which reinforce its competitive moat across AWS, retail, and advertising. AMZN's 20% AWS growth signals a new cycle of AI-driven monetization, with robust backlog and rapid cluster adoption fueling expansion. Short-term earnings were impacted by one-off costs, but underlying North America retail margins and group operating income remain strong after adjustments.

title: AWS exceeds Wall Street's expectations as demand for cloud infra remains high
text: Amazon's cloud infrastructure service, Amazon Web Services (AWS), is on track to record its strongest year of growth in three years, fueled by the AI industry's unprecedented demand for computing power.

title: Amazon shares climb, analysts raise price targets on AWS momentum
text: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) shares surged almost 11% to about $246 after a third quarter earnings beat, with analysts at Oppenheimer and Wedbush highlighting Amazon Web Services (AWS) and AI initiatives as key growth drivers. Following the report, Oppenheimer raised its 12 to 18-month price target to $290, maintaining an 'Outperform' rating, citing accelerating AWS revenue growth.

title: S&P500: Amazon Earnings Lift Tech Stocks as China Trade Risk Eases Today
text: Amazon's earnings spark a tech rebound, lifting the S&P 500. Easing China trade risks support a bullish near-term forecast for US stocks and indices today.

title: Still no sign of surging layoffs despite Amazon, UPS job cuts
text: Amazon's plans to discard at least 14,000 employees and the elimination of 48,000 jobs at UPS suggest layoffs in the U.S. are on the rise, but there's just one problem: There's little evidence to support it.

title: Jeff Bezos Is $24 Billion Richer As Amazon Shares Hit Record
text: Bezos is the world's third-richest person with a fortune valued at $259.4 billion, according to Forbes' latest estimates. Bezos, who holds 8% equity in Amazon, had his net worth swell by roughly $24 billion (10.2%) as of Friday morning, after a $6.6 billion slide as shares dropped Thursday.

title: US stocks surge at open: Nasdap climbs up 1.5%, Amazon rockets 12%
text: US stocks advanced Friday, lifted by strong earnings from major technology companies Amazon and Apple. The S&P 500 rose 0.7%, the Nasdaq Composite gained 1.5%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 83 points, or 0.2%.

title: 5 Things to Know Before the Stock Market Opens
text: Stock futures are on the rise, with tech stocks leading the way after strong earnings reports from tech titans Apple and Amazon. Amazon is set to open at a record high after reporting cloud growth accelerated last quarter; Apple topped quarterly estimates and forecast record holiday-quarter revenue; Reddit shares are jumping on its earnings beat and solid forecast; and Netflix stock is rising higher after the streaming giant announced its first stock split in a decade.

title: Amazon's stock soars 12% on third-quarter beat and increased spending guidance
text: Amazon exceeded third-quarter estimates in its earnings report and lifted its capital expenditures forecast for the year to $125 billion from $118 billion. The company's cloud computing unit, Amazon Web Services, was a big growth driver, with revenue climbing 20% from a year earlier.

title: AAPL & AMZN Push SPX Higher, NFLX 10-for-1 Stock Split & SNAP Benefits Ending

title: Nasdaq likely to take the lead as Amazon lifts Halloween spirits

The Nasdaq was poised to take the lead, with futures suggesting a 1.2% gain.

title: Amazon pops, Apple steadies: What after-hours results say about Big Tech in an AI-jittery market
text: Two of the market's bellwethers released their numbers after the closing bell, and the message to anyone with exposure via SIPPs, ISAs or tech-heavy pensions was clear: cash flows from cloud and services are doing the heavy lifting even as the AI euphoria invites bubble chatter. Amazon.com Inc's (NASDAQ:AMZN) shares leapt around 10% to 13% in late trading after a strong beat, led by a sharp re-acceleration at Amazon Web Services, where sales rose 20% year on year to $33 billion, the fastest pace in nearly three years.

title: Jassy Bets Big on AI Agents as AWS Surges 22%
text: Amazon's latest results, announced Thursday (Oct. 30th) after the bell, gave investors and analysts a snapshot of how AI is powering and fine-tuning everything from eCommerce to enterprise customers operations. And the company is making headway in its grocery efforts as well, management said during the Thursday evening conference call.
